Onion rings on the side were delicious.  Also, tried the sweet potato fries which were very good as well.  Waitress was attentive, refilling drinks and checking in on our table.  I would go back to this bar.  Bill for four people was 36 bucks.  That was for 2 meals, a side of wings, 3 beers and several soft drinks.
Great bar, the cheese sticks are awesome. Great Sunday specials and wonderful service. The bar is very clean and we loved our visit.

If you are looking for a great place, great food, great drinks, and fun atmosphere this is the place to be. Whether you want to party hard or relax with friends this place offers it all! It is by far the best "bar food" you will find anywhere and always with deals and cheap prices! The draft selection is huge and always served ice cold!! I would suggest my favorites the taco Tuesday $1 taco and $2 Mexican beer deal and also the very popular 2-4-1 Thursday's!! This is the best bar in Arizona and I'm sure many other states so trust me done waste your money or time and go there! Also, try the sweet potato frys!!!

I LOVE Devil's! I swear I go every Tuesday for taco Tuesday because their tacos are the BEST! Basically all of them are a dollar except their shrimp tacos. The shrimp tacos are so worth it though! The service is usually pretty good, but it could be improved on. The girls always try to remember my order and most of the time it ends up being wrong because of that, but the food is so good that it makes up for it.

After 3 years at ASU, I finally went to devil's for the first time. I'm currently kicking myself because I'm upset that I've been missing out on cheap drinks and food!  We came on a Friday night and there was reverse happy hour starting at 10. Before 10, they were still having normal Friday drink specials! $5 vodka and $5 jack and coke!  We were meeting up with some family and had a group of 7 people so we definitely took advantage of the specials.   I also ordered the buffalo fries and they were so good. I subbed the blue cheese for ranch no problem and everyone at the table couldn't keep their hands to themselves so we ended up having to order a 2nd batch! Yum. :)   Skylar did an awesome job serving us and being an awesome sport. My uncle and cousins were definitely having a really good time joking with her and embarrassing me, but she was such an awesome server and had a great attitude. :)

A college type bar without the college kids roaming around.  So take that in as your baseline. Food is good for late night eats, I wouldn't recommend this for dinner or a formal date. But what is great about this place is the ambiance and they have a decent beer selection.  They are very accommodating when it comes to big groups, but I consistently have seen slow service, and it is hard to get a hold of the waitresses. We have had to literally flag then down every single time.

A solid "college bar".  Good specials, and lots of fun stuff to occupy your time while you drink (such as shuffle board.)  Nice patio with TVs and a good number of seats. The bar is not a very efficient shape, but a small negative among many positives.

Devil's... the place my younger ASU grad friends have raves about as "the" ASU bar! Conveniently located walkable-close to my neighborhood. I set up a nice Friday evening happy hour with a large group of friends with management's help. I asked for a few tables to reserve and they gave us the entire left side of the bar/restaurant area! Our servers were great, from the mass arrival of most of my friends, all the way til our group had been whittled down a few hours labor to just one table. There was a creeper around our group (oh happy day, before their PM security arrived) and the staff made sure to keep an eye on him until he left and drove away. Not much of a damper on our time.  Although they don't outwardly announce Friday happy hour prices, they have them 3p-7p. Your typical (carbolicious) bar food fare, mix of local and national beers, and well drinks. After a few rounds and some food, I spent roughly $30 on myself. Looks like they broadcast a variety of local and national sports too but especially heavy on the Sun Devils!

Good food. Relaxing atmosphere. Fun place to come for a few drinks. Some of there servers are not very attentive though.  If you asked one of the girls for another drink there response is important not your server. The guy bar tender with the beard is awsome though. Always friendly and is very attentive. That's why I'm giving four stars.

This place wasn't bad, but I was a little irritated by something. I called ahead, because I live in Glendale and this is a bit of a drive for me. I wanted to ask if I could not only watch the Diamondbacks game, but also hear the sound. I can go to any sports bar and watch the game without sound, but when I called they told us we WOULD be able to watch the game with sound.  However, once we got there we were told that we weren't able to watch the game with sound because the NHL playoffs and the NBA playoffs were on. I really don't have an issue with that, but I did have an issue with them telling us on the phone that they would do that for us.  As for the rest, the service really wasn't bad, the Caesar salad is a HUGE portion for only $6.50. We apparently got there during happy hour, so our first two drinks were 4 dollars, but they didn't give us any notification of happy hour until we got our checks.  During our time here we also ordered 2 additional drinks that were 8 dollars a piece. Again, not really a big deal but we had no idea what time happy hour was or when it ended. Most restaurants  tell us it's happy hour when we sit down.  Honestly, i'd probably go back to this place when the playoffs aren't on. They really weren't a bad place overall, but the communication leaves a lot to be desired. They did tell me if the playoffs weren't on, they would have been happy to turn the sound on for me. So, for now i'm just gonna leave it at 3 stars until I get another opportunity to try them out.

We come often tonight the service was poor. we ordered ranch with our meal she brought it out after we finished the meal and still charged us. the worst part is when she picked up my credit card and shoved it in her bra till she got to the register to run it. I have never had a server put my CC down thier bra so disgusting.
Awesome bar. Plus Kendra gave me free food aand I got to watch Boston kill Vancouver for the Stanley Cup finals. Yay!

Great happy hour deals. $4.50 for a giant, nearly pitcher sized beer, solid appetizers, and good food. Lots of TV's, and a pool table or two. The only issue we had was the lack of table seating. For such a large building it seemed like there weren't that many tables. The bar takes up half of the floor space.

I had lunch at this restaurant.   The atmosphere was great with music and a bunch of tvs. The staff was friendly and their menu had a lot of choices at a reasonable price.   I had the Cobb salad. It was great!  I will definitely come again!!!

cool setup inside... get here early if you plan on coming to watch a game and want somewhere to sit. it gets very busy...and you will be shit outta luck when it comes to finding somewhere to plop your ass... other than that cool little spot!

I love this place. It's the closest bar within walking distance to me and I take advantage of that! They have good deals on Thursday nights and it gets packed on the patio. I usually see people I know from school or around town from time to time here. The staff is pretty good. I usually have good service. I like the Aloha Chicken sandwich or the Hawaiian pizza with a tall Blue Moon. They also have big flat screen tv's for football games!

Extremely bland food. If you want to be disappointed, come here. Made both my cousin and I sick after eating. Asked for medium rare burger, they gave me rare. The service was extremely mediocre. She never came to ask us how we were doing, and overall very displease. Never going again.

I am really hard to please and I was very impressed. The remodel is great. There are lots of different areas inside and outside where you can enjoy all the TVs and music. I love the food, the service was outstanding and I really liked the books all over the place. I can see myself hanging here a lot.

**Edited to reply to the Manager** *After receiving a response to my comment on Yelp, I took the time to reply to the manager through email on March 26th. My email detailed exactly why I'd written my review in the way I had and gave a further description of the waitress who'd taken our money. To clarify: I am not blaming this restaurant for the difficulty their patrons have with turning out of the bar, I am simply warning people who may come here to cautious when leaving the premises. My rating was based solely on what occurred within Devil's Advocate.   As of today, April 6th, I have no received a response from the Manager.*    There's something sketchy going on with the staff.   The best thing about this place is price and the worst is their service. Parking isn't awful, but turning west out of the parking lot is a nightmare. I only come here when we're looking for the diviest place in town, and this place always delivers.   Service: THIS was the problem. We had a middle-aged blonde serving us on a Friday night. Service was slow, and our waitress unfriendly. The worst part by far however, was her change giving ability. We had two bills at our table, and she managed to not only round down the change, but had shorted each of us a dollar. I ended up with $7 change after giving a $20 for a $11.39 bill.   I was not drunk enough to miss this. I didn't bring it up because it wasn't a big enough issue that night. Let's be clear: I would've given the waitress that dollar, and more, as a tip. It was nevertheless, a little presumptive of her to just take it.   Food: their bar food is alright. It's nothing to right home about, but they will guarantee you as much grease and carbs as your wallet and stomach can afford. The sweet potato fries are a favorite, as are their wings. Beer prices are cheap.   Moral of this story: don't expect a lot, and pay with a credit card. You won't get your change.

well the owner contacted me, apologized, and offered for me to come in and give it another try on him.....I declined because I knew it wouldn't be a real second chance for his staff to treat me as a valued customer, they would know to expect me. I may return some time again, will report back then.

Cheap drinks for HH!  Cheap food for HH as well, but I'm not really too excited about the food.  I had a chicken tacos, a beef taco, and nachos.  None were very good... the tortillas tasted kind of like I imagine plastic tastes... and they were way too greasy (as were each of the tacos).  The nachos... hmmm, what can I say that is good about the nachos... nothing.  In fact, they were probably the worst nachos that I have ever had.  I really hate to knock a family-owned restaurant, but... perhaps the southwestern style cuisine on the menu should just be taken off and replaced by something else like burgers.    With that said, overall my bill only came out to $17 with two margaritas and three tacos on it!  When I'm in the mood to get out for without busting my budget, then I will be back... even though I probably will refrain from eating any of the food.
At least one tv visible from every seat, wait staff that is friendly and smiling, bar food to meet any requirements, and a large selection of beers on draft. Portobello wrap rocked.

Good burgers and apps.  the service is pretty good and the place has a special all the time.  I think everything is 1/2 price until 7!  Even when that ends they have something special.  Between the billion TV's and cheap booze I'm a fan.

Gooooo Devils!!!!!!! =)  I came here for the first time with a friend for happy hour. He said they have pretty good specials and everything was half off. I got the happy hour menu and ordered the Devils Island. Beware when drinking this! It's like a long island but better and extremely strong!   I also ordered the nachos which were pretty good. I really liked the melted cheese that they used. It was quite yummy.   I'm giving this place a 3 star because the happy menu is quite confusing. It gives you a list of items of food happy hour items, then on the back is the drink menu. However, those drinks were NOT on happy hour. So apparently mine was not. My friend ordered a regular long island and the waitress didn't even know if it was on happy hour or not. Seems like she wasn't very knowledgeable of the happy hour menu. If you go to their website they have an entirely different happy hour menu. It's quite confusing.   I think it's a really good place to hang out with friends for a drink or watch the game. I really liked my drink and nachos. I'd come back, but I definitely think they need to create a better happy hour menu for their customers and their staff needs to be more knowledgeable with it..

Devil's Advocate has decent bar food at decent prices.  Good specials, good prices on alcohol, and very good service! So, why not 4 stars?  I'm not sure.  It's super comfortable, and a nice place to go for Happy Hour, or Taco Tuesday, but for some reason, I just never go. Probably only because I've decreased my drinking and am attempting to go vegetarian.  Or it could be that since I work in Tempe, I'm usually eager to get OUT of Tempe...  It should maybe be 4 stars?

Most people really like this place but I can't say I'm a fan. The food is pretty good and they have decent prices on drinks but I've had some pretty poor service when I've been there. I'm never one to complain about service but it has always been very slow and on one occasion the server told us the wrong happy hour prices and we ended up being charged way more than we were told. Maybe I've just had bad luck here but personally I have not been too impressed.

The food was awesome. I got the Jamaican jerk chicken wrap. Drink deals are awesome. 2 for the price of one on Thursday nights. But the service ruined it for me.....they were standing around and only paying attention to certain customers. I probably won't be back..

Come here basically every Wednesday night for trivia night! The host is lots of fun and recognizes the regulars who come.   Food is decent bar food, and beer on tap can satisfy a ton of different tastes. I'm on the light citrus-y end of that spectrum. Wigs are okay, pizza is good!   Parking is great for being so close to Mill! Will be back next Wednesday!

Very nice! I had a great time here. The service is great & food is amazing! Had the bottomless mimosas I think it was til 2 pm or 3 pm, I forgot but I loved the taste of the mimosas. Also the vibrancy is enormous, outside is nice and inside is cool. Totally coming back here again!

My favorite place in Tempe hands down!! I call it "Cheers" and they always know my name...and my drink! New menu items def make the food choices better. Think high end bar food without the gastropub douchebags. No hipsters here, just decent drink prices, good food and no pretensions. If in Tempe, give it a go!

Yes, it's a college bar, but seriously it's on point with its food. I consider this the best place for a burger in Arizona. I get the Baja, and it's amazing! They also have multiple TVs to watch sports. The staff can be hit and miss sometimes, but the burgers are worth it.

Now Devil's is a fun bar - don't get me wrong. But I had a bad experience with a particular bartender with a nasty temperament.   I walked inside and went straight to the bar to order a drink. Of course, it was crowded because it was Saint Patty's Day. I'd been waiting for 10 minutes or so, and a guy walks up next to me, shakes hands with the bartender (not who I'm talking about) and gets his drinks right away. I wait for another 5 minutes or so, getting more frustrated. Then another guy walks up, super nice, finally gets the female bartender's attention. I believe her name is Lauren. He explained, "These girls were here first", so I quickly asked, "Are you sure?" and thanked him. Then the bartender  says, "You lost your shot." and walks away from us without taking any drink orders... The guy was just trying to be nice... Couldn't believe we were treated in such a way.
This place has good bar food, okay service. Good place to come watch a game they have tons of tvs and a full bar w rotating beers on tap. I would recommend the Black and bleu burger or their wings!
Great service, food & drinks!  Best college bar in Tempe by far!

I was in town for a few days and went to Devils advocate for a drink and some food. We had the best waitress Avery who really made out trip memorable. We ended up coming back everyday just to see her before we had to leave. Will definitely be visiting Devils every time we are in town! Thanks for everything and all the advice on where to go Avery, best service ever!

I am now a fan, after having a bad experience here, the owner read my review and sent me a very personal apology.  Thanks!  That was very considerate and will create more business for you!  Happy new year!!!       This place is great if you love unattentive, lazy, worthless bartenders. With four deadbeats behind the bar and only 10 people actually at the bar it should take less than 10 minutes to get a drink, not the case.  The waitress are little better.  The band  rocked!  Some dude puked right in the front dead center of the bar and everybody bailed off that end, these four genius'  had no idea.   It took almost 15 minutes before anyone even wiped the bartop muchless the floor which took another 10...  Suck..  but the band rocked!  Kung fu grip rules! Don't let this go to your heads boys but you suck as bartenders, stick to the roids.  Lazy and lame.

I decided to give this place a second chance and i was pleasantly surprised. The food was cooked very well and was delicious. The waitress i had was very attentive and my overall experience was a good one. I'll definitely be back for college football games this year. Go Sun Devil's!!
